page.title: 06TOURISM-IRONBRIDGE-TELFORD
page.content: Tourism started when the{Ironbridge was built over 200 years ago. There are half a million people coming to the{Coalbrookdale and Ironbridge area per year. The foreign visitors come mainly from America, Canada, Holland, France, Japan and Sweden. Each year the tourists spend seven million pounds in Ironbridge and Coalbrookdale Wrekin District tourist board attracts people to visit the Ironbridge by putting advertisements in newspapers and magazines and advertising on television about Ironbridge and Telford. The most popular attractions in Ironbridge and Coalbrookdale are the museums and the Ironbridge itself. Tourists can stay at guest houses and hotels but most people stay with friends or relatives. At Blists Hill they have 250,000 visitors a year.
